diff_hunk:
@@ -66,8 +66,8 @@ def step(self, closure=None):
                 state['step'] += 1
 
                 grad = grad.coalesce()  # the update is non-linear so indices must be unique
-                grad_indices = grad._indices()
-                grad_values = grad._values()
+                grad_indices = torch._indices(grad)
body: Many of the sparse methods implemented in aten use and mutate tensor._indices() / tensor._values(). It's not very nice looking at at::_indices(tensor) but I suppose as devs we can eat the notation.
body_html: Many of the sparse methods implemented in aten use and mutate tensor._indices() / tensor._values(). It's not very nice looking at at::_indices(tensor) but I suppose as devs we can eat the notation.
body_text: Many of the sparse methods implemented in aten use and mutate tensor._indices() / tensor._values(). It's not very nice looking at at::_indices(tensor) but I suppose as devs we can eat the notation.
